DataElement.preferredName: Gene Fusion by RNA or Whole Genome Sequencing or Karyotyping Identification Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the gene fusion identified by RNA sequencing, Whole Genome sequencing or karyotype in the patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gene Fusion Whole Transcriptome Sequencing Whole Genome Sequencing Karyotyping Identification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any hybrid gene formed from two previously separate genes. Such fusions occur as a result of translocation, intersititial deletion or chromosomal inversion, and often result in gene products with functions different from the two fusion partners. Gene fusions are associated frequently with hematological cancers, sarcomas and prostate cancer._A procedure that can determine the nucleotide sequence for all of the RNA transcripts in an individual._A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for nearly the entire genome of an individual._The preparation, analysis, and interpretation of a karyotype, the representation of the chromosome set of a cell._The procedure of having an identity established.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any hybrid gene formed from two previously separate genes. Such fusions occur as a result of translocation, intersititial deletion or chromosomal inversion, and often result in gene products with functions different from the two fusion partners. Gene fusions are associated frequently with hematological cancers, sarcomas and prostate cancer.

Concepts.definition: Any hybrid gene formed from two previously separate genes. Such fusions occur as a result of translocation, intersititial deletion or chromosomal inversion, and often result in gene products with functions different from the two fusion partners. Gene fusions are associated frequently with hematological cancers, sarcomas and prostate cancer.

Property.preferredName: Whole Transcriptome Sequencing Whole Genome Sequencing Karyotyping Identification
Property.preferredDefinition: A procedure that can determine the nucleotide sequence for all of the RNA transcripts in an individual.:A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for nearly the entire genome of an individual.:The preparation, analysis, and interpretation of a karyotype, the representation of the chromosome set of a cell.:The procedure of having an identity established.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that can determine the nucleotide sequence for all of the RNA transcripts in an individual.
A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for nearly the entire genome of an individual.
The preparation, analysis, and interpretation of a karyotype, the representation of the chromosome set of a cell.
The procedure of having an identity established.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
